bug.summary: Deprecation warning in resolve_config suggests to write None instead of none into config file
bug.description:
The deprecation warning raised <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Epistimio/orion/blob/29c0dfc13637aa3add6a57ce585232d65afcc541/src/orion/core/io/resolve_config.py#L244>here</denchmark-link> when using a config with the following content: algorithms: random: seed: null suggests to change the config to the following: experiment: algorithms: {'random': {'seed': None}} The None should be null in yaml/json files. Expected behavior The deprecation warning should show null (proper yaml syntax). Steps to reproduce See the example config in the bug description above Environment (please complete the following information):
OS: Ubuntu 18.04 Python version: 3.6.9 Or√≠on version: 0.1.7 Database: PickleDB
See PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Epistimio/orion/pull/391>#391</denchmark-link>
Instead of calling repr(backward_value) use yaml.dump(backward_value) <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Epistimio/orion/blob/29c0dfc13637aa3add6a57ce585232d65afcc541/src/orion/core/io/resolve_config.py#L247>here</denchmark-link>
